item.description:
Fellow foodies Elisa and Stephanie suggested checking out Beehive, which was deemed "Boston's Best Hot Spot" by Improper Bostonian magagzine's Annual Boston Best 2007, with which I wholeheartedly agree.

Our reservation is during Restaurant Week, however our brunch is not expected to be part of the prix fixe deal. Here's the Beehive Brunch Menu

Below are OPTIONAL pre and post brunch activities:


Yes RSVPs are required for the brunch only.



12:00 PM - Meet at off white wooden shack (540 Harrison Ave 02118) to browse the SOWA Open Market, which is an outdoor urban shopping bazaar. (hours are 10AM - 4PM)
1:30 PM - Brunch at Beehive (we'll be grouped at several tables because this is cafe seating...you're welcome to table hop)
3:30 PM - Meet at Sovereign Bank (61 Harrison Ave 02111) to catch the August Moon Festival in Chinatown (10AM - 5PM)
6:00 PM - Meet on Beacon Street side (Arlington Street intersection) of Arthur Fiedler footbridge (DCR Hatch Shell Directions) to check out the India Day Celebration at DCR Hatch Shell (4PM - 9PM)

If you're not able to join us for brunch, catch up with us at the listed locations and times....I'll have a BBLD sign.

Brunch is rain or shine however the other activities are subject to weather.

Parking: Call Beehive at 617 423 - 0069 for details

Plan your public transportation route at either
MBTA or HOPSTOP.

RULES of Engagement for Brunch:

Please be considerate of your fellow diners time by arriving promptly so we can be seated together.

Please bring enough cash to pay for your meal, drinks, tip, and tax.

All RSVP's are on a first come, first served basis.

You may only RSVP YES or NO. Maybe isn't an option.

Please RSVP YES only if you are certain you will attend.

If you're not sure you can attend because you have other unconfirmed plans or uncertain transportation, please RSVP NO with a comment requesting to be placed on wait list.

If brunch is full and you wish to attend, please RSVP NO with a comment to be wait listed.

If there is an overwhelming response, the reservation may be increased or another seating arranged.

If your name appears on the event page as a YES after the event and you have not attended the event, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If I must change you're RSVP to NO because you haven't replied to final update event confirmation email deadline, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If you change your RSVP from a YES to a NO within twenty-four hours of the event, without an explanation, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If you are a NO-SHOW for three events you are removed from the group.

NO-SHOWS impact everyone; from you, who could or has been on the wait list to the organizer as well as the restaurant's.

If it is less than twenty-fours from the meal and you are not able to attend or are running late, you must contact me directly by calling or texting 617 445-7549.

An email from you explaining your absence is an expected courtesy.

If you are removed and there were extenuating circumstances, please email me about rejoining.

Your feedback is appreciated so please, rate the event and venue by completing surveys afterward.
